title: Sidekiq Web returns 500 on metrics page with period 1h
body:
Ruby version: 3.2.5
Rails version: Not using rails
Sidekiq version(s): 8.0.1

When navigating to the metrics page, if there is no period URL parameter set or the period parameter is 1h, we get a 500 error. Any other value for the period parameter works as expected.

```ruby
# Gemfile
source 'https://rubygems.org'

gem 'rackup'
gem 'rack-session'
gem 'webrick'
gem 'sidekiq'
```

```ruby
# configu.ru
require 'rack/session'
require 'sidekiq/web'

use Rack::Session::Cookie, secret: SecureRandom.hex(32), same_site: true, max_age: 86400
run Sidekiq::Web
```

```bash
# To start webrick server on localhost:9292
bundle exec rackup
```

Go to localhost:9292/metrics and it should blow up with 500:
```
Rack::Lint::LintError: a header value must be a String or Array of Strings, but the value of 'refresh' is a Integer (Rack::Lint::LintError)
	/Users/dev/.rbenv/versions/3.2.5/lib/ruby/gems/3.2.0/gems/rack-3.1.12/lib/rack/lint.rb:726:in `block in check_headers'
	/Users/dev/.rbenv/versions/3.2.5/lib/ruby/gems/3.2.0/gems/rack-3.1.12/lib/rack/lint.rb:701:in `each'
	/Users/dev/.rbenv/versions/3.2.5/lib/ruby/gems/3.2.0/gems/rack-3.1.12/lib/rack/lint.rb:701:in `check_headers'
	/Users/dev/.rbenv/versions/3.2.5/lib/ruby/gems/3.2.0/gems/rack-3.1.12/lib/rack/lint.rb:76:in `response'
	/Users/dev/.rbenv/versions/3.2.5/lib/ruby/gems/3.2.0/gems/rack-3.1.12/lib/rack/lint.rb:41:in `call'
	/Users/dev/.rbenv/versions/3.2.5/lib/ruby/gems/3.2.0/gems/rack-3.1.12/lib/rack/show_exceptions.rb:31:in `call'
	/Users/dev/.rbenv/versions/3.2.5/lib/ruby/gems/3.2.0/gems/rack-3.1.12/lib/rack/common_logger.rb:43:in `call'
	/Users/dev/.rbenv/versions/3.2.5/lib/ruby/gems/3.2.0/gems/rack-3.1.12/lib/rack/content_length.rb:20:in `call'
	/Users/dev/.rbenv/versions/3.2.5/lib/ruby/gems/3.2.0/gems/rackup-2.2.1/lib/rackup/handler/webrick.rb:111:in `service'
	/Users/dev/.rbenv/versions/3.2.5/lib/ruby/gems/3.2.0/gems/webrick-1.9.1/lib/webrick/httpserver.rb:140:in `service'
	/Users/dev/.rbenv/versions/3.2.5/lib/ruby/gems/3.2.0/gems/webrick-1.9.1/lib/webrick/httpserver.rb:96:in `run'
	/Users/dev/.rbenv/versions/3.2.5/lib/ruby/gems/3.2.0/gems/webrick-1.9.1/lib/webrick/server.rb:310:in `block in start_thread'
```

If I change these lines to use strings for the refresh header value, it works fine:
* https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/blob/main/lib/sidekiq/web/application.rb#L73
* https://github.com/sidekiq/sidekiq/blob/main/lib/sidekiq/web/application.rb#L87

It worked fine with rack < 3.1 on Sidekiq 7 but Sidekiq 8 has a rack dependency of >= 3.1
